definition: at that moment/just then
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
sentences.chinese: 他当口贴尘埃，或者有指望。

sentences.english: The oratorio is being prepared. At this juncture Bach appears, and creates cantatas that endure.
sentences.chinese: 清唱剧产生在即的当口，巴赫带着他的康塔塔出现了。

definition: the very moment/just then/during (that brief interval)
urgent and important moment (idiom); critical juncture
(dialect) critical juncture/crucial moment/Taiwan pr. [jie2 gu5 yan3]
erhua variant of 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
juncture/moment
to be just about to/to be on the point of
by coincidence/it so happened that/fortunately/against expectation
now/at this moment
(dialect) obviously/clearly
unexpectedly/suddenly/at unawares/off guard/against expectations
side/side-room/room in the wings
just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
behind/the back/the rear/later/afterwards/(in) the future
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
in front/at the head/ahead/above
classifier for affairs, events etc
